1.display: An improved Fishing Rod. Fish will no longer flee from it, and some will even be more attracted to it than usual.
1.name: Divine Fishing Rod

2.display: A stronger version of the Bomb Rod. The jewel at the tip is blue now, and it can destroy rocks and crystals more easily.
2.name: Blue Bomb Rod

3.display: An improved tool for splitting firewood and cutting down trees for lumber. It's been modified for better balance and sharpness, making gathering easier than ever.
3.name: Golden Axe

4.display: An improved tool for gathering grass and flowers. It's been modified to make gathering easier, and reaps everything as quietly and lightly as the wind.
4.name: Silent Sickle

5.display: A mechanical arm made by the Sirens. It has a crushing grip strength and an extremely powerful mining laser. It might be useful for gathering alchemy materials.
5.name: Laser Cutter

6.display: A shellfish commonly found near beaches. Roast it over an open flame and dig in for a delicious meal.

get_access.1: Obtained through: Gathering Site TH4 - The Desolate Capital

6.name: Pourpremoule

7.display: A freshwater fish found in rivers and lakes. It is a common sight on the dinner table.

get_access.1: Obtained through: Gathering Site TH4 - The Desolate Capital

7.name: Sardine

8.display: The lord of all fish that live in lakes.

get_access.1: Obtained through: Gathering Site TH4 - The Desolate Capital

8.name: Lake Master

9.display: A collection of transparent stone fragments. It includes a variety of materials, including rare and expensive jewels.

get_access.1: Obtained through: Gathering Site TH3 - The Castle of Strife

9.name: Small Crystals

10.display: Sand that can be collected by pulverizing rocks. It smells like a volatile gas and burns up when lit.

get_access.1: Obtained through: Gathering Site TH3 - The Castle of Strife

10.name: Burning Sand

11.display: Crushed lava ore in a powdered form. Even as a powder, it's still magma and may suddenly combust if left unattended. It will be a disaster if you let it get scattered by the wind.

get_access.1: Obtained through: Gathering Site TH3 - The Castle of Strife

11.name: Magma Powder

12.display: A common weed that grows absolutely everywhere. It has no distinct features, which is why it doesn't have a proper name. At the same time, it's also a staple ingredient in a large number of alchemy recipes.

get_access.1: Obtained through: Gathering Site TH1 - The Land of Beginnings

12.name: Nameless Grass

13.display: A plant with leaves that resemble a bird's wings. They are very light and are easily carried around by the wind.

get_access.1: Obtained through: Gathering Site TH1 - The Land of Beginnings

13.name: Wing Plant

14.display: This type of Taun is distinct from regular Tauns due to its reddish-black coloration, which comes from the fact that it only grows in soil rich in iron. It is very flammable, even when it hasn't been dried.

get_access.1: Obtained through: Gathering Site TH1 - The Land of Beginnings

14.name: Blood Taun

15.display: A seemingly normal ore that hides the power of lightning. It's most often found at high areas where thunderstorms are common. Some believe the ore was transformed after being struck by lightning.

get_access.1: Obtained through: Gathering Site TH2 - The Underworld Grove

15.name: Lightning Ore

16.display: A fragment of a gigantic meteor. They always come in pairs, and are connected no matter how far they are from each other. Some say you can use them to teleport... maybe.

get_access.1: Obtained through: Gathering Site TH2 - The Underworld Grove

16.name: Star Fragment

17.display: A rainbow-colored ore that glows from within. Despite its appearance, it's actually one of the hardest known ores. In fact, it's nearly impossible to process using conventional means.

get_access.1: Obtained through: Gathering Site TH2 - The Underworld Grove

17.name: Septrin

18.display: A strange crystal ore collected from the Central Foundation. It's durable, contains energy from all elements, and might serve as a good alchemy material.

get_access.1: Obtained through: Gathering Site TH5 - The Central Foundation

18.name: Strange Crystal Ore

19.display: An armor plate salvaged from a wreck in the Central Foundation. Its hard, splendid white surface appears to have been tempered using all elements. It may be useful as a potent alchemy material.

get_access.1: Obtained through: Gathering Site TH5 - The Central Foundation

19.name: Strange Armor Plate

20.display: A core that powered the guardian of the ancient ruins. Even after being taken out of the guardian, it continues releasing energy, seemingly never running out.

get_access.1: Obtained through: Gathering Site TH5 - The Central Foundation

20.name: Strange Energy Core

21.display: A small bottle containing elemental power. It has an affinity with all elements, which is useful but also makes it difficult to work with.
21.name: Spirit Bottle

22.display: A common alchemic compound. A red liquid with fire affinity.
22.name: Red Neutralizer

23.display: A common alchemic compound. A blue liquid with ice affinity.
23.name: Blue Neutralizer

24.display: A common alchemic compound. A yellow liquid with lightning affinity.
24.name: Yellow Neutralizer

25.display: A common alchemic compound. A green liquid with wind affinity.
25.name: Green Neutralizer

26.display: An advanced material created from the four Elemental Cores. Since it has high affinity with all elements, it's extremely useful in alchemy.
26.name: Crystal Element

27.display: A key that's symbolic of the Underworld Grove. Its handle is embellished with a light-pink topaz, evoking the image of a once lush forest when holding it.
27.name: Underworld Grove Key

28.display: A key that's symbolic of the Land of Beginnings. Its handle is embellished with a flawless diamond that's as etermally pure as the hearts of those who seek out adventure.
28.name: Land of Beginnings Key

29.display: A key that's symbolic of the Desolate Capital. Its handle is embellished with a turquoise emerald, reminding you that the true reward of an adventure is not gold and silver, but rather the journey itself.
29.name: Desolate Capital Key

30.display: A key that's symbolic of the Castle of Strife. Its handle is embellished with a dazzling ruby, making you wonder if the long-buried brutal truth has forever been lost to the sands of time.
30.name: Castle of Strife Key

31.display: An item resembling a keycard, made from combining the other four keys. It should slot into the device by the barrier's door at the Central Foundation.
31.name: Central Foundation Key

32.display: Obtained by gathering 10,000 Crystal Clusters. This item is required to make the Ruins Explorer Sculpture.
32.name: Crystal Cluster Badge

33.display: Obtained by playing Operation Hot Spring for seven days. This item is required to make the Ruins Explorer Sculpture.
33.name: Operation Hot Spring Badge

34.display: Can be added to the Core Nexus in The Alchemist and the Archipelago of Secrets, granting the following effect in corresponding event stages: increases the FP, AVI, and TRP of your ships.
34.name: Offense Boost Core

35.display: Can be added to the Core Nexus in The Alchemist and the Archipelago of Secrets, granting the following effect in corresponding event stages: reduces the DMG taken by your ships.
35.name: Defense Boost Core

36.display: Can be added to the Core Nexus in The Alchemist and the Archipelago of Secrets, granting the following effect in corresponding event stages: in combat, your ships slowly restore HP over time.
36.name: Regeneration Core

37.display: Can be added to the Core Nexus in The Alchemist and the Archipelago of Secrets, granting the following effect in corresponding event stages: once per battle, when one of your ship's HP falls beneath 20.0%, she will regain a portion of her HP.
37.name: Damage Control Core

38.display: Can be added to the Core Nexus in The Alchemist and the Archipelago of Secrets, granting the following effect in corresponding event stages: your fleets will receive supporting barrages during combat that Burn enemies hit.
38.name: Covering Fire Core

39.display: Can be added to the Core Nexus in The Alchemist and the Archipelago of Secrets, granting the following effect in corresponding event stages: your fleets will receive supporting barrages during combat that will temporarily increase the DMG taken by enemies hit.
39.name: Anti-Armor Volley Core

40.display: Can be added to the Core Nexus in The Alchemist and the Archipelago of Secrets, granting the following effect in corresponding event stages: your fleets will receive additional EXP from sorties.
40.name: Experience Boost Core

41.display: Can be added to the Core Nexus in The Alchemist and the Archipelago of Secrets, granting the following effect in corresponding event stages: your fleets will gain additional Affinity from sorties.
41.name: Affinity Boost Core

42.display: A core component of Augment Module - Sparkling Reverie. Can be used in synthesis.
42.name: Sparkling Reverie Module

43.display: A core component of Augment Module - Astrumnox. Can be used in synthesis.
43.name: Astrumnox Module

44.display: A core component of Augment Module - Grand Floracion. Can be used in synthesis.
44.name: Grand Floracion Module

45.display: A core component of Augment Module - Edel Schwert. Can be used in synthesis.
45.name: Edel Schwert Module

46.display: A core component of Augment Module - Elder Lily. Can be used in synthesis.
46.name: Elder Lily Module

47.display: A core component of Augment Module - Oren Herald. Can be used in synthesis.
47.name: Oren Herald Module

48.display: A core component of Auxiliary Gear - Grand Bomb. Can be used in synthesis.
48.name: Grand Bomb Module

49.display: A core component of Auxiliary Gear - Crystal Ice Bomb. Can be used in synthesis.
49.name: Crystal Ice Bomb Module

50.display: A core component of Auxiliary Gear - Laute Plajig. Can be used in synthesis.
50.name: Laute Plajig Module

51.display: A core component of Auxiliary Gear - Wirbel Luft. Can be used in synthesis.
51.name: Wirbel Luft Module

52.display: A core component of Auxiliary Gear - Genesis Hammer. Can be used in synthesis.

get_access.1: Obtained through: Day 2 request completion rewards

52.name: Genesis Hammer Module

53.display: A core component of Auxiliary Gear - Bubble Bullet. Can be used in synthesis.

get_access.1: Obtained through: Day 2 request completion rewards

53.name: Bubble Bullet Module

54.display: A core component of Auxiliary Gear - N/A. Can be used in synthesis.

get_access.1: Obtained through: Day 3 request completion rewards

54.name: N/A Module

55.display: A core component of Auxiliary Gear - Apocalypse. Can be used in synthesis.

get_access.1: Obtained through: Day 3 request completion rewards

55.name: Apocalypse Module

56.display: A core component of Auxiliary Gear - Mystic Robe. Can be used in synthesis.
56.name: Mystic Robe Module

57.display: A core component of Auxiliary Gear - Elixir. Can be used in synthesis.
57.name: Elixir Module

58.display: A core component of Auxiliary Gear - Energianica. Can be used in synthesis.
58.name: Energianica Module

101.display: A mushroom that contains crystallized spores in its cap. Inedible, of course. Its crystals are processed into jewelry.

get_access.1: Obtained From: TS1 Gathering Site: Entrance Area

101.name: Jewel Mushroom

102.display: A bug that looks like it's carrying a mushroom on its back. The mushroom is actually part of the bug, so forget eating it.

get_access.1: Obtained From: TS1 Gathering Site: Entrance Area

102.name: Mock Mushroom

103.display: The spiky fruit of a plant. Often used as a throwing weapon. Its flesh is also quite tasty if you crack it open.

get_access.1: Obtained From: TS2 Gathering Site: Abundance Stratum

103.name: Uni

104.display: A type of Uni which has largely crystallized. The non-crystallized parts can be consumed, but they don't taste very good.

get_access.1: Obtained From: TS2 Gathering Site: Abundance Stratum

104.name: Crystal Uni

105.display: Noxious gas collected from the emissions of rotting wood. The fumes are very toxic and can immobilize a person for days if inhaled.

get_access.1: Obtained From: TS3 Gathering Site: Rot Stratum

105.name: Rotwood Miasma

106.display: A fluffy, glittering bubble composed of incredibly tiny particles of metal. They're so small that it might be more accurate to call this a gas rather than a metal.

get_access.1: Obtained From: TS3 Gathering Site: Rot Stratum

106.name: Air Chime

107.display: Ore that converts ambient heat into cool air. It's great for keeping materials fresh.

get_access.1: Obtained From: TS4 Gathering Site: Ruin Stratum

107.name: Glacial Stone

108.display: A type of hibiscus that blooms around mining areas. As a material, it gets used as both a plant and as a metal.

get_access.1: Obtained From: TS4 Gathering Site: Ruin Stratum

108.name: Hibismuth

109.display: It possesses sharp spines able to easily penetrate anything that touches its exterior. Despite being named after mossy balls of algae, this seaweed is actually a relative of Uni.

get_access.1: Obtained From: TS5 Gathering Site: Skynexus Stratum

109.name: Marimo

110.display: A fish with toxic spines. It extends them to protect itself when threatened.

get_access.1: Obtained From: TS5 Gathering Site: Skynexus Stratum

110.name: Poisoned Puffer

111.display: A crystal ore that grows around the Skynexus Tower. It possesses physical energy.
111.name: Skynexus Tower Crystal Ore

112.display: A core of condensed Skynexus Tower energy. It possesses immense energy.
112.name: Skynexus Tower Energy Core

116.display: A core component of the Augment Module Ephemeral Record. Can be used in the Atelier as a key material when synthesizing Ephemeral Record.
116.name: Module - Ephemeral Record

117.display: A core component of the Augment Module Secret Triaina. Can be used in the Atelier as a key material when synthesizing Secret Triaina.
117.name: Module - Secret Triaina

118.display: A core component of the Augment Module Huntress. Can be used in the Atelier as a key material when synthesizing Huntress.
118.name: Module - Huntress

119.display: A core component of the Augment Module Hellion Mantis. Can be used in the Atelier as a key material when synthesizing Hellion Mantis.
119.name: Module - Hellion Mantis

120.display: A core component of the Auxiliary Gear Endemeteo. Can be used in the Atelier as a key material when synthesizing Endemeteo.
120.name: Module - Endemeteo

121.display: A core component of the Auxiliary Gear Superior Grimoire. Can be used in the Atelier as a key material when synthesizing Superior Grimoire.
121.name: Module - Superior Grimoire

122.display: A core component of the Auxiliary Gear Granshine. Can be used in the Atelier as a key material when synthesizing Granshine.
122.name: Module - Granshine

126.display: A core component of the Auxiliary Gear Panacea Sphere. Can be used in the Atelier as a key material when synthesizing Panacea Sphere.
126.name: Module - Panacea Sphere

127.display: A core component of the Auxiliary Gear Heavenly Armillary. Can be used in the Atelier as a key material when synthesizing Heavenly Armillary.
127.name: Module - Heavenly Armillary

128.display: A core component of the Auxiliary Gear Enfer Cube. Can be used in the Atelier as a key material when synthesizing Enfer Cube.
128.name: Module - Enfer Cube

129.display: A basic alchemical solution. Red Neutralizer has an affinity to fire.

get_access.1: Obtained From: Synthesis in the Atelier

129.name: Red Neutralizer

130.display: A basic alchemical solution. Blue Neutralizer has an affinity to ice.

get_access.1: Obtained From: Synthesis in the Atelier

130.name: Blue Neutralizer

131.display: A basic alchemical solution. Yellow Neutralizer has an affinity to bolt.

get_access.1: Obtained From: Synthesis in the Atelier

131.name: Yellow Neutralizer

132.display: A basic alchemical solution. Green Neutralizer has an affinity to air.

get_access.1: Obtained From: Synthesis in the Atelier

132.name: Green Neutralizer

133.display: Neutralizers are fundamental chemicals frequently used in alchemy. This is one was refined to be all-purpose and usable with any and all potential materials.

get_access.1: Obtained From: Synthesis in the Atelier

133.name: Rainbow Neutralizer

134.display: Specialized equipment for tuning the Skynexus Tower's energy. Equipment level 1.

get_access.1: Obtained From: Synthesis in the Atelier

134.name: Skynexus Tower Energy Tuner 1

135.display: Specialized equipment for tuning the Skynexus Tower's energy. Equipment level 2.

get_access.1: Obtained From: Synthesis in the Atelier

135.name: Skynexus Tower Energy Tuner 2

136.display: Specialized equipment for tuning the Skynexus Tower's energy. Equipment level 3.

get_access.1: Obtained From: Synthesis in the Atelier

136.name: Skynexus Tower Energy Tuner 3

137.display: Specialized equipment for tuning the Skynexus Tower's energy. Equipment level 4.

get_access.1: Obtained From: Synthesis in the Atelier

137.name: Skynexus Tower Energy Tuner 4

138.display: A general material used for base-building. Can be used to install wooden objects.
138.name: Wood Construction Materials

139.display: A general material used for base-building. Can be used to install stone objects.
139.name: Stone Construction Materials

140.display: A general material used for base-building. Can be used to install metal objects.
140.name: Metal Construction Materials

141.display: A general material used for base-building. Can be used to install plant objects.
141.name: Plants Construction Materials
